DataElement.preferredName: Medication Addendum Question Baseline or Acute Past 24 Hours Take Any Medication Except the Study Drug for Nausea Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of the reason they took a medication for nausea, other than the study drug, in the past 24 hours.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Medication Addendum Question Baseline or Acute Past 24 Hours Take Any Medication Except the Study Drug for Nausea
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The sensation that one is about to vomit._The reflex act of ejecting the contents of the stomach through the mouth._An appendage to an existing document that contains supplemental information. The parent document remains content is unaltered._Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument._A starting point to which things may be compared._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Having a severe and rapid onset of symptoms with short duration._A question about whether an individual took any medication, except the study drug, for nausea in the past 24 hours.
